alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 6:42PM EDT until September 09 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Harlan. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dizney, Black Mountain, Kenvir, Colts, Highsplint, Clover- Darby, Louellen, Black Bottom, Closplint, Lejunior, Cranks, Crummies, Holmes Mill, Bobs Creek, Three Point, Martins Fork Lake and Clover Fork.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
